word:
They hurry down a hearty dinner, then go in to work while all the nervous energies are needed in the digestive process, and they force these powers away from their legitimate work and duty to the muscular system, and at the close of the day they are exhausted and overdone.--Letter 85, 1888, pp. 9, 10. 

Ellen G. White Estate Washington, D. C. July 19, 1984
